overview: This subject involves an in-depth innovation investigation under the supervision of a member of the academic staff and in the context of the University's engagement initiatives. Students working in groups will be required to perform research, customer and problem discovery, ideation, concept creation and validation, and technical implementation for a real-world challenge. The subject also provides students with skills and knowledge for improving written and oral communication.
Indicative content includes innovation methodology, customer & problem discovery, customer & problem validation, innovation experiments, and innovation presentations.
ilo: Work independently as part of an interdisciplinary team to complete a technical innovation project
Collect and critically analyse a range of data about people and their problems, and create innovation hypotheses from this data
Conceptualise, design, and implement an innovative and technology-based solution to the identified problem
Present technical solutions to non-technical stakeholders in both written and oral forms
generic_skills: Be able to undertake customer & problem discovering, problem formulation and solution
Have a capacity for independent critical thought, innovative inquiry and self‐directed learning
Have a profound respect for truth and intellectual integrity, and for the ethics of scholarship
Be able to present work in written form; and
Be able to present work orally and answer questions about it

Prerequisites.content: with a Weighted Average Mark (WAM) of at least 70
If you meet this criteria please complete an Enrolment Variation form.  Subject Coordinator approval is NOT required.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: A group of four project proposal. Approximately 20 hours per student. Due end of week 1. Intended Learning Outcomes (ILOs) 1 - 5 are assessed as part of the proposal.
assessment.hurdle: Students must pass the project proposal to pass the subject.

assessment.brief: A 15 minute group of four presentation. Approximately 10-15 hours of preparation per student. ILOs 3, 4 and 5 are assessed in this presentation.
A group of four project progress report. Approximately 80 hours of work per student. ILOs 1 - 5 are assessed in this report.
A technology innovation solution. Approximately 50 hours of work per student. ILOs 3, 4 and 5 are assessed in this presentation.
A 20 minute group of four presentation. Approximately 15-20 hours of preparation per student. ILOs 3, 4 and 5 are assessed in this presentation.
A final group project report, with an individual reflection for each student. Approximately 150 hours of work per student. ILOs 1 - 5 are assessed in this report.

date_times.contact_hours: 1 x 2 hour weekly lecture; 1 x 2 hour weekly workshop
